data.title: Good good&good price
data.text:
Staff are all very friendly and prompt. Those making the sushi are all nice and engaging. It's not a massive place but it's rarely too hectic during the lunch hour. 

I opt for the all you can eat. Stick to the nigiri and you'll get your money's worth. There is a lot of rice but the fish always seems fresh. You can order certain appetizers and various rolls but I've only tried a few and have had the best luck with the nigiri. 

My favorite all you can eat sushi in the state.

data.title: Sushi  is not all about rice
data.text: Was disappointed  with sushi at this place. Please check their  website and their picture gallery will make you wanting to go there.  But in real it's the cheapest repetitive  sushi that u can get. Some busineses know how to lure people in. Regular china buffet  have better taste of sushi than this restaurant.  We had all u can eat for $21.00 per person. Maybe if you buy regular  priced sushi they will make it better, I don't know. Most of it is rice, barely any filling. Come one we didnt came in to eat rice and simple sushi. If your profession is sushi than make it apealing and tasty. People rather eat less sushi but quality. Trust me my sushi that I  make at home is much better, fansier, and at least have some taste  to it and decor. The serving plates that they bring sushi on is not appealing. Also you have to eat from a kid size plate, it's unbelievable. Server brought about  2 teaspoons of spicy mayo, when you dip few times it's gone and on their menu it says you have to pay a $1 for extra sauce if you ask again. I've asked server is that all what we get?, she said" yes, that's a free one and than you'll have to pay $1, but I told her that there is barely  any sauce  to begin with, u can see a plate trough it. Also I told server that I don't like your sushi, It has no taste to it and she replied: "you are eating it because it's just  there?" No apologies, didn't ask what they can do to make it better. Customer  service  is terrible. We've  been to many sushi places and know how professional  sushi looks and tastes...

data.title: Unbeliavable quality for all you can eat.
data.text: All you can eat but made to order. It is not a buffet where sushi stays there for hours. I was imoressed with the fresh salmon. Rolls are very good. For $15 you get unlimited appetizers like edemame, veggie tempura, miso soup, crab rangoon.  All the sushi we ordered was great. We were hesitant to go in but we are so happy we did. BTW we eat sushi a lot, everywhere we go in the world, so we know sushi.  Of course, americanized menu, with house special rolls not found anywhere else. Very good.

data.title: Good sushi, great service
data.text:
We have eaten here several times over the last several years.  Yes, the menu could be a bit confusing in that it says "included" for several items, but that does not mean they waste food by automatically putting it out.  You have to ask for it just like you do for the rolls and nigari (have seen other all you can eat places that do the same in other states).  Not a reason to down check a place when you just had to ask.

Daughter, wife and me for daughter's B-day lunch, Wednesday at 11:30 AM.  Wife had the shrimp bento box for about $13, daughter and I had the AYCES for $15 each.
 
I  took half a dot off because there is a better sushi place within 10 miles, but it is not all you can eat, more expensive, and I think Tony's is a bit friendlier.  I took another half dot off because the rolls (lunch menu) are semi-repetitive compared to another location about five miles away (all you can eat) but Tony's is cleaner and has better quality control. Over all I rate Tony's (for lunch) at 4.5. 

Reading some other reviews on other sites, if you do eat here, realize that the term SUSHI comes from one of the main ingredients, cooked vinegared rice or sushi-meshi.  If you just want the toppings, then you need to order SASHIMI, which is a LOT more expensive.

Overall our rolls, soup, and nigari were very good, the vegetable tempura was above average, and the crab rangoon was good too.  

The wife liked her bento box, but had to give us some of her stuff because she could not eat it all.

The wait staff was one older Asian and one young Anglo, both were good at keeping us up to date and eating.  There were tables of one single, two, seven, and four, plus our three and it looked like we were all kept satisfied.

Value, that is very subjective.  It has been some time since I ate AYCES elsewhere, so I may be a bit off (especially with the economy issues), but I would say 4.5 rounded down.

When I want to sushi out, this is my first choice in the Layton, Utah area.

Oh, and I marked "Is this one of the best meals you've ever had in a restaurant?" as no.  The best AYCES (with many other American and Asian items) was a semi-true Japanese style all you could eat restaurant in Escondido, California back in 2002 (since closed).  THAT was a top of the line place ($35 if I recall)!  Was stuffed for two days, yummmmie.

data.title: Sushi and more
data.text: My eldest daughter and her husband took my wife and I out to lunch.  Tried new sushi and was again most pleased with all that was presented. Had a fine time eating and talking, staff did not rush us, and was always there when we need service.  Will be back.

data.title: Good Sushi, Good Value
data.text:
Tony's decor is cute, with modern lighting and cheerful colors.  Service is friendly, though sometimes a bit slow as the restaurant can get packed quickly.  We sampled a variety of rolls, Philly, Seared Eel, Spicy Tuna, Yellowstone, and Spider Maki, each of which was fresh and very good.  The seaweed salad is less salty than most, a good thing.

Tony's has several interesting value options.  One is all you can eat, but we found the $9 Combo meals to be quite filling and excellent value.  This includes meso soup (just ok), a salad with a unique and very tasty slightly sweet ginger dressing, a roll selected from their extensive menu, crab rangoons, gyoza, and tempura vegetables.  The onion ring was especially good, with very thin battering.

data.title: Great space with great food
data.text:
The folks at Tony's know how to fill you up.  The servings are  a good size for the price and the choices are ALL tasty, trust me, I have tried them all...
Go early to get good parking.

data.title: Fish that had died a terrible death!
data.text: It was a deal! "All you can eat sushi". Unfortunately, I could only eat a couple of pieces before I told the waitress that the sushi was rotten. It smelled terrible and was discolored. I became sick within a half hour of leaving. They did nothing to remedy my situation and charged me full price.

data.title: Sushi
data.text: wonderful selection of Sushi with great sides. the selection also has an all you can eat of any items. experiment

data.title: Pretty good sushi for the Wasatch front
data.text: All you can eat for a good price.  Pretty good for Utah.  Service is a bit slow.  We have been there 3-4 time and it has always been slow.

data.title: Meh
data.text: Service was below average (it took a long time to get our order and the waitress seemed a bit overwhelmed).  The restaurant was was not very clean.  Food was average.

data.title: Visit from PA
data.text: Second time there from visiting my son and it was great again. Great food great price......Had the all you can eat sushi.   Yum!

data.title: Awesome
data.text:
If you like sushi, that's the place to go.
All you can eat delicious sushi for $15.99 plus soup,edamame, fries veggies and crab wontons !
The place is very clean and stuff is super nice.

data.title: Should have had the sushi
data.text: Found myself looking for Japanese food on a Tuesday night and decided to give Tony's a try.  They had a special of all you can eat sushi for $21...which sounded good but I didn't think I could eat that much sushi...and it looked like a long wait for sushi with all the people there. I ordered the ribeye bento and well...lets just say I think I would have been happier with the sushi.  The meat was cooked and then smothered in teriyaki so it wasn't as flavorful as it could have been. The tempura was a little batter heavy and the California roll was...meh.  Service was spotty due to the many folks there with only two servers. I think it's worth another shot and will visit it again when I return to the area.

data.title: Simply delicious
data.text: Tony makes the best sushi I've had in Utah. The all you can eat menu is delicious and varied.  Crab ragooon is my absolute favorite I could make a meal of just that. Not to be missed.

data.title: Good,  innovative sushi.
data.text: My husband loves Tony ' s and always gets the all typy can eat dinner sushi for $21.99. This comes with all you can eat appetizers which include crab rangoons, tempura veggies, and miso soup. The crab rangoons are very good.  I'm not a raw sushi eater so I love that they offer sushi made with grilled chicken and steak. My husband loved everything from long rolls to sashimi. I would recommend this place highly.

data.title: Good food great chefs
data.text: Tony's provides a good all you can eat sushi option for this area. They are not the highest quality sushi, but provide a good basic selection and good quality at a very reasonable price. What takes their restaurant from good to great is Caesar and Tony. They are very friendly and funny and work diligently to ensure that their customers have a wonderful experience. We visit this establishment monthly and often multiple times per month.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: We went to this restaurant based on the good reviews on this page.  We ordered the AYCE sushi dinner.  We were seated right away and got our drinks and appetizers.  We waited a long time for our food and when it finally came our order was incomplete (we never got a roll so we ordered it again).  We waited nearly 20 minutes for our second order of one roll.  We had to flag other waitresses down to get drink refills or other items. All the rolls had too much mayo in them.  The sushi was not good and the service was bad.  It cost over $50 and we felt robbed.  We will not be back.

data.title: Better than simply sushi
data.text: Sushi rolls here are a lot more creative than simply sushi. Sushi chef Tony does is very friendly. I would got there again. They even have vegetables tempura included in the all you can eat.

data.title: LOVE!
data.text: Tony's is great! I think the sushi is all we really go there for so I can't really tell ya how their dishes are but the sushi is so awesome. All-you-can-eat for $15 each. I recommend it to a lot of family & friends. Their service isn't the best because they only have a few severs but I don't really care about that. The servers I think are the owners tony and his wife and they are waaay nice!! I recommend the sunrise or sunset sushi. Soo good!
